Q10:
climate change generally refers to gradual shifts in the earths climate, meaning average temperature, rainfall etc will increase or decrease in areas over time.
generally speaking, the term climate change usually is meant to refer to manmade climate change, where the effects are the same, but the causes are industrialised atmospheric alterations and on a much shorter timescale
X1_Q20:
carbon pollution in the atmosphere
overuse of fossil fuels
agriculture producinging large amounts of emmissions
X1_Q24: generally CO2 causes climate change, the sources vary but are largely due to the use of fossil fuels or large scale agriculture

increase in the average global temperature
ocean level rises and seafood dieoffs
erratic weather patterns leading to droughts, floods, storms

Q10: Carbon based life forms and their activities impacting our world/climate
X1_Q20:
Impacts from the heating/cooling cycle of the Sun
Increase in world population
Greenhouse effect - Methane, CO2, Nitrous Oxide and CFC's
Human activities such as mining, manufacturing, farming etc. increasing greenhouse effect
X2_Q20:
Increase or decrease in temperatures
Change in seasons
Change in climate areas (tropical to desert)
Increased intensity of droughts, floods, storms, cold snaps, heat waves
Traditional food production systems will not produce enough food
Water shortages and decreased quality of available water
Potentially increased sea levels
X3_Q20:
Educate the world. Scare tactics will only do so much.
If people believe in the effort they will all contribute.
Consumerism and greed are our biggest problems
Reduce pollution with severe penalties for polluters
Recycle
Use natural resources to generate electricity (Sun, Wind, Ocean)
Create new fuel sources to power the world's transport systems. From cars to planes
Look into more efficient and sustainable food production systems
Have to start considering population control measures, as the world cannot sustain ever increasing numbers
X3_Q24:
We have to get a lot better at recycling. There is a lot of talk about recycling, but very little do
We have to re-use or breakdown what we have used. You cannot keep producing. You will run out.
Apart from the 10c plastic bottle refund, that we are paying for anyhow, there is no drive or incentive to re-use, re-purpose,re-design
This is one the biggest crises facing us, and we are not devoting any energy, resources or intellect towards solving this issue
We must elevate this. It is a key part of saving our world
resp1: Educate the world. Scare tactics will only do so much.
resp2: If people believe in the effort they will all contribute.
firstlist:
• Educate the world. Scare tactics will only do so much.
  • If people believe in the effort they will all contribute.
  • Consumerism and greed are our biggest problems
  • Reduce pollution with severe penalties for polluters
  • Recycle
  • Use natural resources to generate electricity (Sun, Wind, Ocean)
  • Create new fuel sources to power the world's transport systems. From cars to planes
  • Look into more efficient and sustainable food production systems
  • Have to start considering population control measures, as the world cannot sustain ever increasing numbers
